metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5129 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A lack of parameter validation on IPC messages results in a potential out-of-bounds write through malformed IPC messages. This can potentially allow for sandbox escape through memory corruption in the parent process. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.7, Firefox ESR < 52.7, and Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
